team6.finalproject

Class Odometer

  • java.lang.Object
    • team6.finalproject.PausableTimerListener
      • team6.finalproject.Odometer

  • public class Odometer
extends PausableTimerListener
    Class that creates a coordinate plane to allow the robot to understand where it is and to simplify navigation.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sean Lawlor, Andrei Ungur

    • Constructor Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Odometer

        public Odometer(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                int INTERVAL,
                boolean autostart,
                double wheelRadius,
                double robotWidth)
        Constructor for Odometer.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that is our left motor
        rightMotor - the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor that is our right motor
        INTERVAL - the int that is our polling interval
        autostart - the boolean telling us to start
        wheelRadius - the double that is the radius of the wheels
        robotWidth - the double that is the length of robot's chassis

    • Method Detail

      • timedOut

        public void timedOut()
        Recompute the odometer values using the displacement and heading changes every Timer loop.

        Getter for X value
        Returns:

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(double[] position,
                        boolean[] update)
        Set position in the position array
        Parameters:
        position - a double array representing our position by holding x and y coordinates
        update - a boolean array signalling if an update is needed or not

      • getPosition

        public void getPosition(double[] position)
        Getter for the total position array
        Parameters:
        position - the double array holding the x, y, and theta values for the odometer

      • getPosition

        public double[] getPosition()
        Getter for position but in a synchronized block to return a new position.
        Returns:
        position double array holding the x, y, and theta values for the odometer

      • getMotors

        public EV3LargeRegulatedMotor[] getMotors()
        Getter for both motors
        Returns:
        the EV3LargeRegulatedMotor array holding both our left and right motors (to stay synchronized)

        Returns:

      • minimumAngleFromTo

        public static double minimumAngleFromTo(double a,
                                        double b)
        This method ensures the robot turns the minimum angle when going to a new heading
        Parameters:
        a - the double first angle
        b - the double second angle
        Returns:
        The minimum double angle to turn to
